content:
Nice clash, only issue is that your constraints say:
"1 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 150"
but currently Test 2 has n = 0.

For now I'll just edit your constraint to say:
"0 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 150"

This lost me about 10 seconds in my clash, because I figured I didn't have to worry about n=0, but then realised I did.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: quick and fun clash

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Yup, good to go
A fun problem, but the factorial of 150 is a large number with more than 200 digits, which can be difficult for some programming languages to handle.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice fun CoC

Title
* Suggest to change to "What is the d-th digit?"

Goal
* Please change "[[n!]]" to "[[n]]<<!>>".

* Please change "{{d-th}}" to "[[d]]<<-th>>".

Constraints
* Please move everything to Goal section.

* Please add to here:

1 ‚â§ [[n]] ‚â§ 150
1 ‚â§ [[d]] ‚â§ length of [[n]]<<!>>

Input
* Please change as follows:

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[n]]
<<Line 2>>: An integer [[d]]

Output
* Please change as follows:

Two space-separated integers: the length of [[n]]<<!>>, and the [[d]]<<-th>> digit from the end of [[n]]<<!>>.

Cases
* Can [[d]] be changed so that the required d-th digit is not mostly 0?

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Thanks.

I improve my statement as you told and also change the test cases.
thank you,..üê∏‚ù§

BTW,,, you told me to add this"* Please change as follows:

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[n]]
<<Line 2>>: An integer [[d]]
"
but i wants to take the input of n and d in one line??!
is it good??

its true... a Example is C++üôÇüòÅ ..

some days ago i am trying to print fct. of 200 in cpp.. and i saw "0" in output!!!!!   after some research i found cpp can not handel these big numbers..

Yes, you can. Sorry, my bad, I suggested the wrong description. Please change as follows:

Input
* Two space-separated integers: [[n]] and [[d]].

Also:

Constraints
* Please move everything (i.e. from "For example" up to "manipulate strings!") to Goal section.

* Please add to here:

1 ‚â§ [[n]] ‚â§ 150
1 ‚â§ [[d]] ‚â§ length of [[n]]<<!>>

Thanks.
yes.. no problem.. now i think everything all good.?!
